name: sfchronicle
text:
A’s pitching coach Scott Emerson talks to @susanslusser about Frankie Montas, A.J. Puk, recent Rule 5 acquisitions, and everything else Oakland fans need to know about A’s pitching in 2021.
https://t.co/1pUqauN7GE

name: sfchronicle
text:
Officials at San Quentin State Prison began a series of mandatory transfers, which some medical personnel resisted and labeled as hasty, ill-advised and fraught with risk.
https://t.co/jVwWcpc7Zv

name: sfchronicle
text: Composer Pauline Anna Strom, who earned a small but devoted following in the early 1980s with a series of probing electronic soundscapes released under the name Trans-Millennia Consort, died over the weekend in her San Francisco apartment. She was 74. https://t.co/KQN3OheYOL

name: sfchronicle
text:
A flurry of COVID-19 risk assessment tools have rolled out over the past months aiming to help people make decisions about what to do, and what not to do. 

But how useful are they as we enter what many are calling the most dangerous time of the pandemic? https://t.co/AneMWYCirp

name: sfchronicle
text: Nursing homes are poised to begin vaccinating residents and staff as soon as this week. But is the inoculation safe for older people? Experts say the benefits outweigh the risks. https://t.co/MQ4DyTiHx9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Coronavirus vaccines have arrived in the Bay Area. But a lot of questions remain.

Here’s what you need to know:
https://t.co/6HCNrQgtV8

name: sfchronicle
text: President Trump’s unfounded claims of election fraud were ignored Monday as California delivered Joe Biden the Electoral College votes that put him over the 270 he needed to clinch the presidency. https://t.co/zt35KUafOA

name: sfchronicle
text: Tight end George Kittle could return before the end of the regular season. The chances of quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo doing so are less likely. And wide receiver Deebo Samuel, barring a playoff appearance, won’t play again until 2021. https://t.co/0ti9t43vj1

name: sfchronicle
text: Many local leaders have partnered with San Jose and Santa Clara County officials and aligned their community work to respond to the coronavirus pandemic, which has disproportionately impacted the largely Latino and Vietnamese neighborhood in East San Jose. https://t.co/A2kiUEUZL4

name: sfchronicle
text: A judge on Monday signed a warrant for police officer Terrance Stangel’s arrest. He is the third SFPD officer that Boudin has criminally charged in a use-of-force case in the past month as part of his campaign to hold police accountable for wrongdoing. https://t.co/I1j9olGmS6

name: sfchronicle
text:
An SFPD patrol car hits and injures two cyclists after running a red light, a victim's attorney says.

Read more: https://t.co/xNUsnAR3GY https://t.co/oceOvj2qDG
